title.narrative: Environmental Support Programme, Phase 3 (ESP3) , engagement

description.narrative:
The overall ESP3 development objective is: “Inclusive and sustainable growth through improved environmental management and climate change mitigation and adaptation”. This development objective is well aligned to the various goals and objectives outlined in current environmental and natural resources policies, including the National Medium Term Development Plan (RPJMN) and the climate change and energy policies.
Component 1 aims at supporting the effective implementation of consolidated environmental management and climate change policies by combining support to three thematic areas, at both national and decentralized level. The component objective is: Improved local impact from implementation of policies and environmental management, also in the field of climate change mitigation and adaptation.
Component 2 immediate objective is EE, EC and RE policies effectively implemented with a focus on the local government level, and experiences from pilot projects used to strengthen national policies, strategies and climate changes planning.
Component 3 immediate objective has been defined broadly to accommodate the differences in scale, scope, aim, and entry level of the sub-components: Climate change mitigation through natural resources management including community based NRM approaches.
FL §06.32.02.07 Indonesia

policy-marker.narrative: Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Comp 3 Outcome 5 Indicator: ESP3 support to FIP II is contributing to an increasing # of rural communities within selected FMUs implementing agreed, participatory natural resources management plans

description.narrative: Institutional Development for Sustainable Forest and Natural Resource Management’ (World Bank Forest Investment Programme – FIP II) strengthens institutional, financial and technical capacities at national level to improve sustainable forest development and reduce emissions from deforestation and degradation, generate local level knowledge on participatory land-use planning and support Forest Management Unit (FMU) pilot projects. ESP3 finances 25% of the total budget

title.narrative: Comp 3 Outcome 5 Indicator: ESP3 support to FIP II is contributing to an increasing # of rural communities within selected FMUs implementing agreed, participatory natural resources management plans

title.narrative: Comp 3 Outcome 1 Indicator: Encroachment into the 98.555 ha Hutan Harapan Ecosystem Restoration Concession has stopped and there is secured financing for PT Reki (the concession holder) management until at least 2021

description.narrative: Outcome description: Hutan Harapan is sustainably managed with the support of strategic partnerships for the benefit of biodiversity conservation, community livelihoods and ecosystem services including climate change mitigation

title.narrative: Output 4.1 indicators: Support tools for sustainable landscape development widely used in three provinces and nine districts, and ready to be used by other areas of Indonesia (LUMENS, ABACUS, FERVA protocol)

description.narrative: Output description: Land-use Planning for Development with Multiple Environmental Services (LUMENS) provides a framework and capacity building approach for planning for emissions reduction from the land-based sector and it also facilitates a multi-stakeholder negotiation process to formulate low-emissions development strategies through scenario and trade-off analysis. ABACUS is an Abatement Cost Curve Generator, and FERVA is used to implement Fair and Efficient Value Chain Analysis.

title.narrative: Comp 3 Outcome 3 Indicator: Indonesia Sustainable Landscape Programme (SLM) operational and green development studies contributing to activities in the waste sector

description.narrative: The REDD+ support facility multi-donor trust fund assisted the Government of Indonesia to implement the national REDD+ strategy and ensure a continued focus on upholding rights of local communities. In 2015 the REDD+ support was converted to adopt a landscape approach to address Indonesia’s NRM challenges with a priority on reducing forest and land fires and haze.

title.narrative: Comp 3 Outcome 3 Indicator: Indonesia Sustainable Landscape Programme (SLM) operational and green development studies contributing to activities in the waste sector

description.narrative: The REDD+ support facility multi-donor trust fund assisted the Government of Indonesia to implement the national REDD+ strategy and ensure a continued focus on upholding rights of local communities. In 2015 the REDD+ support was converted to adopt a landscape approach to address Indonesia’s NRM challenges with a priority on reducing forest and land fires and haze.

comment.narrative: Original REDD+ support restructured to address the evolving needs of Indonesia, and now focused on sustainable landscapes and green development, largely as a reaction to the report prepared in 2015 entitled ‘The Cost the Fire’ outlining the implications of the continued fire problems in the country

title.narrative: Output 3.1 indicator: Indonesia Sustainable Landscape Programme (SLM) operational and green development studies contributing to activities in the waste sector

description.narrative: Updated output reflecting new priority to address forest fires and their causes
